TEXT: I was in possession of this car for 6 months. In those 6 months the hood stopped working, the door locks and the CD player stopped working, the interior started rattling and squealing, and the gas gauge broke. That was an NBC from 2007! If you are thinking about buying this car, please keep looking. Maybe a Mini? Believe me when I say: GREAT CONCLUSION! If you already have one... good luck!

We bought this vehicle in Jan after months of searching. Had a 6-cylinder Ford Windstar minivan and wanted SUV style without the high cost and poor fuel economy. After 3300 miles, as other reviewers began to hear rattling noises in the driver's side, as well as hesitation in accelerating. Returned at 8500 miles, and it was said that a new gearbox was needed! They had to replace others. I got the car back just 3 days ago, and it's still hesitating, but it's gone, for now. I loved this car, but I'm not sure it will last for many more years. Don't roll down the two rear windows as air pressure / noise is terrible.

I bought the Kia Optima a year ago - this is my third Kia. About a week before the switch cable came off and nearly crashed into a car when I parked, I received a greeting card from the dealer. The dealer inspected the cable and said that they had never seen anything like it before - nothing was broken or damaged, the cable just came off. Now, almost a month later, I'm driving with the shotgun in my husband's truck because the cable has "come off." I seriously believe that this model has a design flaw and am just glad I never tried to use the switch function - imagine the cable would "come off" at 75 miles per hour on the motorway!

I have a 2007 Nissan versa, I have startup problems, very intermittent, turn the key over for about 10 seconds, just crank and don't start, my wife is embarrassed when she tries to start it as well, plus I have sensors with weatherproof stripes falling off the back doors in the same place, not too impressed by the mileage of the petrol engine as what's on the sticker.

I was so excited about the redesigned 2007 Passat Wagon! What a mistake! I've had this car THREE times since I bought it in March 2006. The engine malfunction keeps flashing up and the dealer can't find the problem except to say that there's an evaporator leak he can't fix. The service manager also explained that he had several Passats that did this. Please don't think the dealer will help you with these problems; YOU WON "T... I wrote a letter to VW and they weren't willing to help me either. Volkswagen will NOT stand behind your vehicle. Nor will the brakes squeak. Don't buy this vehicle.

I've loved Chevrolets and GMCs for 30 years. My 03 Chevy Silverado was the best truck I've ever had. My 08 GMC was the most disappointing truck I've ever bought. I get alarms all the time, including: parking assist off, airbag, low tires when they're not. In addition to the alarms the dealer can't fix, I've had two interior fans replaced, and they rattle again. The engine is tapping even though I'm taking the recommended action. ABS brakes look like I'm on ice on a dry road. Cheaper braking system. Discs already warped. My o3 brakes were 144K miles wide. The sun visors aren't wide enough to block the sun.

I currently have one for a company car. Nearly 70,000 in 2 years. Vehicle has plenty of power to move around on busy roads, interior is nicely laid out (I have automatic climate control). No SYNC on previous models. Decent fuel economy on such a larger vehicle. Styling is nice, even after 70,000 miles, it's still nice to look at. Fever-feverish problems: Check your hood! Corrosion on the bonnets is a MAJOR problem. I've seen over half with corrosion problems. OEM tires are terrible! I'm currently in the third set, now driving GoodYear Integrity tires. Better ride, better wear. Poor manufacturing standards; doors not exactly lining up, hood misalignment etc. Front brakes wear prematurely.

I am very disappointed with this purchase, the paint has burst and continues to bubble on parts that had been repainted before, which sounds like you need new breaks, all within 3 months of purchase. Headlights had to be replaced completely, washing liquid leaks from the hood, the rear paint fell off and again everything bubbles with 6 months of ownership of the vehicle. If you own the old sage, please go over it and check for bubbles of pinhead paint. It squeaks like an old truck on very hot days and long drives in stop-and-go traffic, has no pickup truck, the dashboard color is reflected on the windshield, which is a bit distracting. I will never buy a Mazda.

I bought my first Honda after doing a lot of research on the fuel economy of cars. I bought it new with six miles on it and had problems with it drifting to the right. I already had it four times. The first time they had a front adjustment that had failed. It was still pulling to the right. When they came back that day, they changed the tires from back to front and said it was a radial train and they put all the new tires on it. It was drifting on and now they tell me it was the road and all the Hondas drifting to the right. It never moves to the left. Also, they scratched my paint when visiting with their free laundry. Very unfortunate!!!

I've had my cobalt for a little over a year now, it's a fun little car, but I was expecting more. I added new rims / tires and a new exhaust because the exterior was reasonably plain. The interior looks really cheap, Chevy needs a major interior upgrade. I've yet to see what the mileage Chevy promises looks like, a little frustrating. I'd say it's a good entry-level car, but not really able to compete with other cars in the same category, it just falls short.

I recently had a problem with the car, so the air conditioner was just blowing hot air. A visit to the dealer showed an undetected leak in the coolant of the system. They couldn't find the leak after 4 hours and put a dye in the refrigerant to try to find the leak. I've never had this problem with a Japanese vehicle. Has anyone else had this problem? I'm supposed to drive the car now for three months and return the vehicle to "discover" the leak.

First we loved this car, then the problems started. Twice I had it fitted because of leaking doors from the drain pipes of the sunroof, soon it will be installed again. Seats are ruined by water damage. If we replace the stay holders, recall the wiper blades, we seem to be unable to repair the popping noises underneath. We are very upset, and also the car does not even make it to our driveway because of the gravel. It stinks of front-wheel drive! We wish we would never act. I feel cheated. This car is a lemon!!

It's the most uncomfortable car I've driven. I'm at just over 600 miles and only get 25 mpg on the highway! I've been researching for months and thought I was making a smart purchase decision. I'm not going to buy another one.

I think you get a lot for your money, but I have only had my car changed for a year and 6 months and I already have the left front and right front axle and a door handle that fell off a passenger visor. I also had to have my air conditioner replaced because of peeling and now I am waiting for a door lock controller and a headlight on the right. I wonder how much I will have to spend after the 2-year warranty if I have to endure these frequent workshop visits without even having an accident and owning a new car. I would suggest a different car. I am thinking of the new Audi crossover Hyundia. By the way, I hate the unstable cup holders, cheap fans.

If I had known then what I know now, I would never have gotten this Buick LaCrosse. This Buick has been to the dealer 5 times because of ONE problem, something with the steering column. I got an extended warranty from Buick, but that didn't work. It still doesn't work properly. The car goes back for lap six and the SAME EAT. I never drive American cars again. Thank you Buick for making such great American products. HA

This car is smoke and mirrors. It is slow, uncomfortable, gets poor gasoline performance and is overpriced. Paid 45K for a car and must tolerate 17 phone dummy switches because the car has no Bluetooth? Frankly, research BMW, Saab, Audi before buying this brand. I would return the car tomorrow if I could. Every day I go to this vehicle and wonder why I paid so much for a car with so little? Mercedes Benz must make about 20 big profits with each of these "very, very average" cars.

I have had problems with this car since the day we drove it home from the dealer. After 4 months of trying to deal with Nissan, we still have no one who really takes responsibility to repair or replace this car. We have waited weeks for calls. We have a brand new car that we don't want to drive and no one seems to know how to fix it. Nissan also ignores the service department of the dealer who is trying to repair this car.

Bought as a replacement when I destroyed my 07'saturn vue. 08' Lucerne CX, it was a dealer demo with about 2,400 miles on it. In the first month, I heard a rattle / humming from the front area. Brake light stayed on until I went to the dealer for repair. Dealer replaced a fuel line problem because there was a GM bulletin on it. So far, I've had the car in 5 times because of the rattle and still rattled / buzzing. I'm "disillusioned" with this Buick. I'll try rattle repair again... then I'll contact GM personally. (You probably won't care / or react to it) The dealer understands my problem anyway. I'll buy Honda next time.

After the first month in possession of this enclave, there was nothing but trouble. Since June 08, we had two software updates for the gearbox (trans gear still terrible. Pretend not to know which gear it should be in). The rear lid opens automatically (if the car is fortunately off). When the automatic mode is off, we still hear the elevator engine turn on. The heat control stopped working twice. Sometimes, all the indicators read as if the car was off. At 75 MPH for almost two hours, the best MPG I get is 17. In town, it's a good day to get 13 MPG. The dealer tries his best, but I don't think there's much time for improvement.

The first time this happened on Thanksgiving Day! Had to have the SUV towed from the gas station, the manual hand brake function did not work. Just today I went shopping and the parking brake malfunction continued! Had to wait over 2 hours for the tow truck. No other option but to have the SUV towed. Very cumbersome! And has to wait until Monday until the dealer opens! Even more inconvenient! Also, I had to change two tires twice for nail plates, extended flats cannot be repaired, spent over $1000! A tire changed, SUV not even one month old! Not safe for long drives! DO NOT BUY!

I am sad to say that I have just had an accident with my cobalt from March 2008. My cobalt and a mini-van collided at a very low speed and my car had $7,700 worth of damage. I could not believe how bad the damage was at low speeds of less than 25 miles per hour. Airbags did not deploy. It was at an intersection with residential buildings. I have another 4 years left after taking out a 5-year loan. I am very angry about everything. I will not buy another cobalt if it is available.

I am a car transporter. My maximum weight is 20,000 lb. I have 19,000 (5 months) miles on the truck with 3 weeks in business for repairs to the cooling system. It was difficult to do business with any kind of performance.

I bought this car brand new on 23 / 05 / 07. After 2 months I called the dealer and said I was dissatisfied with the mpg. I paid extra for the CVT gearbox to get 33 / 36 mpg. Any day (even if I use synthetic oil) my best speed is 30 mpg. He said no one twisted my arm to buy the car. (no wonder Nissan tore its contract from this dealer.) Upholstery is rubbed where the child seat sometimes sits. Carpet where the clutch would be if it was manual looks like I took a razor. Mold on the rear right pane comes off. Air conditioning no longer works shortly after the warranty. They will not help to repair a / c system on a 2 year old car. Too bad that I would upgrade to murano in 2 years.

The worst mistake I have ever made when buying a car. It is a really nice car, but that's it. The purely plastic interior smells like cheap. At the windshield you lean into the steering wheel to see when the red light changes. No console and thus no proper storage space. The smallest thing you put on the dashboard is very missing. The seats are uncomfortable. The space between you and the passenger is almost non-existent. Really cramped feeling. No console between seats and cup holders is the worst thing I have ever seen in a vehicle. The armrest sits too low to have any use.

Loved the car for the first 15K, then the problems started. Strut, valve body, alignment (still not repaired and the dealer does nothing about it), windshield wiper fluid tank had to be replaced, horn failure, the rear window came out of track. That's too many problems for someone who takes good care of his car. Besides, it BURN oil! after 5k of the recommended 10k oil change intervals I am over 2qts low, VW says this is normal? I have just under 25k in the car and have decided to say goodbye. I could not have imagined this, the car was for the first 15K PERFECT... when buying a used car pay attention to the alignment problem, very soon I am told.

Nice looking truck, but far too many serious problems in two years. SW issue that causes the battery to run out if the battery is drained with this particular problem, then call a flatbed. Seal leak on the front right axle (can't really be fixed as this is a design problem... just replace the same gasket if it leaks!) failure of the 4WD driver. Failure of the front distribution box... Special order for needed parts. Rear plastic bumper loses "shape" on the bottom within a year... looks very cheap. Very frustrating.

I now have 5 Ford F-250 or Ford F-350 diesel trucks. I tow trailers and use my trucks to work every day. I loved all of my Ford trucks until 2008. This truck is scrap. The 2005 Ford F-350 was one of the best trucks I ever owned. It had tremendous power and fuel performance that pulled my 48 "trailer the way I drive with about 11 mpg. The 2008 model gets 5.9 mpg. I had two radiators replaced. The exhaust system had numerous repairs where most dealers did not know what to do. It repeats itself idle with my foot on the brake clean and will lag forward. Ford continues to tell me that it will not do this. I have discussed this issue with Ford, I am tired of Ford.

I had nothing but problems with the fuel system with which I contacted Dodge, and they know about the problems but refuse to fix them. I was told I could watch a DVD if I had any questions, the problem arose with Blue Tech, after I bought the truck (with all the blue techs) to fix it, you have to dive for 45 minutes without going under 45 km / h and under 2000 rpm per week, and they give the truck terrible wear and tear for no reason. I tell everyone I know not to buy Dodge, because if something goes wrong, it's your fault to buy their product if you don't have the time to buy a Ford or Chevy for no reason.

I drove my Corolla for a year with the impression that it feels like a big car and has a very gentle feel (in fact, the softest ever), then something broke and the dealer was unable to fix it. Now, I don't feel safe on the highway, because if I hit even a small bump (and especially a series of small bumps), it feels like I'm losing control. At slower speeds, it's just uncomfortable to drive on anything but the slightest roads. The dealer claimed to replace the front braces, and maybe they did because it seemed to reduce the rough feel for a day or two.

When I first saw the car, I fell in love with it. Since then, I wish I could divorce! Terrible rattling, squealing and poor workmanship. The car has been in business here and there for over 15 days. I know that VWs are known for their excellent workmanship, but this car has loose dashboards, the black paint bubbling and peeling off the release / locking buttons. Maybe it's my lemon, but I would never recommend VW to anyone! I just hope my bonus is big enough to trade in this piece of garbage! Too bad that something that looks so good is so bad!

The repair problems caused me to get rid of this car after only having it for 10 months. It seems as if it is hard to hold before it falls apart. I have never been unlucky enough to ever get a car like this.

I've had my automatic Fit Sport for about 1 1 / 2 years and wouldn't recommend it. Gas output in the city is only about 28. Air conditioning throttles engine power and can't keep cool in the heat of the AZ summer - gets warm, cold, warm, cold. Interior upholstery is a lint magnet. Biggest downside - car is loud and rattles all over, with a big rattle in the dashboard. If you had that from the start, the service can't fix it. Visibility is poor with huge dead spots on the front and very hard to see when reversing, especially if you're short like me. Tires go low in the air, alignment goes down slightly, the engine makes a high sound, the service says they "can't hear it." The same applies to friction noise when turning left.

It looks good, performs poorly. The mileage of the gas is 20-21 mpg city and 23 mpg highway. CRV has squealing and rattling in the car. Vehicle shifts roughly from 1st to 2nd place of stop, start and go. The dealer says it is in electronic program transmission. CRV pulls hard to the right on the road at low / high speeds. I was at a Honda dealer who says that there is a Honda Service Bulletin since 01 / 2007 before buying the car and that later new steering column rods / pins need to be installed, which can be ordered again from Honda, so that a proper wheel alignment can be done on a new car, right?) I was never notified before or after buying from the dealer, so be warned.
This van is louder than my 1-ton truck. Dealer said that they all sound like that. Interior gets slightly dirty and scraped. Van doesn't get much more mpg. Than my 1-ton 4-WD truck.

I was even a faithful Chrysler man in the 1970s / when "build quality" was just a word in the Chrysler dictionary. By and large, I'm unhappy with this vehicle. I should have got the Hemi because it couldn't drink more gasoline than this 3.7. This vehicle gets the worse fuel economy of any other vehicle I've ever owned or driven. It's also energy efficient, so if you're going to make a pass, you'd better plan ahead and allow plenty of space.

Really bad design, because the buttons are not sealed and fail with only a few drops. Audi will not lag behind. Costs $1000 for replacement in the first 6 months. Fear of using the cup holders that are above the chosen one. 2 drops and another $1000. Coil the hassle. Want my Range Rover back.

If I had bothered to check if this trash can had depreciated $15,000 in 3 years, I would have come across this car. Unfortunately, I did not, and now I have the pleasure of fixing all the KNOWLEDGE GM design problems on steering column, brake rotors, steering bar and strut. I had 1960-era cars with better steering and suspension systems. Of course, because GMC is an American company, it is based on greed, not customer service; they refuse to fix / recall any of these problems because not enough people have died in the car. I look forward to the day when I can unload this lemon!

I bought this piece of American scrap in 08. Until now, the doors had to work, the heater / air conditioner engine only works with interruptions, the dealer can of course not find a problem. I just finished the front brakes at 23,000 miles. I suspect the use of inferior materials, bad acceleration on the highway, frozen calipers on the rear brakes and the dealer tells me that it could take a week until they come. My hope is that Chrysler disappears from business. I will never buy another.

This is my second Mini. The clutch went out in the first after 2 1 / 2 years and only 22,000 miles. The cause was found to be a manufacturing fault and was covered. My 2008 Mini S has only 10,727 miles and is also a standard gearbox. The clutch slipped on this. It is currently at the dealer and I am waiting to see if the repairs are covered. I do not drive the clutch and do not drive aggressively or even need to shift as often (not much stop-and-go traffic). I have read many posts on other sites about Minis and clutch problems. Buyers beware!!!

I bought this brand new 2008 LE V6 in late 2008. Within a week, the seat and steering wheel vibrated when driving 65-75 miles on the highway to get to work. Also had problems with the Bluetooth. Turned on multiple times. Finally, a TSB was sent out by Toyota after months of complaints regarding vibrations / shivers, but it did not completely solve the problem. Toyota Rep insists that it is the way Camry is constructed. If Honda had been the first Tokota for 20 years, incredibly disappointed. Don't feel safe.

From day one we had a constant smell of gas. We took it inside and half a tank of gasoline later could not find a problem. Used to drive it and the smell got worse. Mpg Highway was around 18, City at best 15. Winter was terrible because it would get stuck in 1 / 2 inch of snow. We had the pebble leather and it reflected very poorly in the windshield.

I love this car... Now I can't wait to return it! It seems like the problems are only getting worse. Airbag light is always on... I'm tired of having to fix it. Electric windows seem to have their own head. Then, the windshield wipers, say, I had to change the engine. Now, I have an epc start problem... Nobody seems to understand that. After reading all these reviews, my brake pads are worrying... I guess it will never end until I get rid of this car: (

I've been driving this car for 3 months now. I average 22.5 MPG in most suburbs, with a round trip of 20 miles a day to work. I also use it to deliver papers every morning, which takes about 30 minutes. I'm driving the same routine in a Honda Civic that had a bigger engine and got 30 MPG, so I'm very disappointed with the fuel economy. Even in the open road you can see the throttle gauge falling visibly, you can only lock the driver's side with the key - that's a pain when you're carrying bundles and / or it's raining.

The first Highlander of the year 2001 was better than my 2008. Poor visibility. Seat is so uncomfortable that you can not drive for long. 2008 does not cope as well as the previous model. No traction in the snow. Mine is a four-wheel drive with 6 cylinders. Interior parts fall off. Very disappointed with the Highlander of the year 2008.

I will never buy a VOLVO again. On this car the engine was replaced, new brakes, roof squealed and the main computer went off. The car is 2 years old and has only 10,000 miles The biggest waste of $49,000!!!

The bells and whistles could be of better quality. Not enough power. The gearbox seems to have trouble finding the gears. My control engine lights up three times. The most frustrating thing is that the car is leaking when it rains! The car is rusting outside now. The car has been serviced three times and they still haven't repaired it properly.

I bought this XD with the Trans car, that was the first mistake. This thing scares me the hell while I'm trying to interfere with the 70km / h traffic. Road noise is excessive and the ride is pretty bumpy. Brakes are sufficient but spongy. Highway mpg is not too bad at 38, but local driving is dismal 23mpg. Rear passenger space is surprisingly sufficient for average-sized people. Rear storage space is small, but this is a subcompact and is to be expected. The hubcaps had to go. I bought 7 spoke wheels that look much better.

The doors had a good, solid feel. This is the first car that made me sick as a driver when the car rolled around in fast corners. I averaged only 28 km / h on the highway with the Sentra. This was probably due to the ride height, the springy gas pedal and the CVT gearbox. Nissan still needs to improve its workmanship. Plastic looked like it came from a branded toy. The bottom line is that you can get better driving dynamics, quality, fuel economy or value with a Corolla, Civic or Mazda3.

I did some research and discounted the Fit, Yaris etc. in favor of the Versa bc with horsepower, space and the reputation of Nissan. At first it exceeded all my expectations - fun to drive, reliable, good fuel economy, easy to use. Then came winter. In cold, wet weather I went to the car and found ice all over the dashboard, the controls and inside the windows and windshields. The controls did not work and the doors did not close. Warm up - no change. Repairing it at the dealer proved extremely problematic, it did not happen - the repair cost for me was quoted at 5-10K. I just swapped it for a 2009 model - hoping for better this time. It will probably be my last Nissan too.

I bought this 10 months ago and am looking to trade it in, even though I know I will make a los. has tons of cargo space and legroom, but the engine works too hard. Doesn't feel like it shifts properly. Not very darty--takes a long time to accelerate. Gas mileage for me has been constant at 18 miles and less. I've never even gotten 19 miles per gallon as stated. 14 gallon tank is small - feels like I'm always at the gas station. radio and amenities are well positioned for a comfortable ride. Great heat and air conditioning, but it's hard to hear radio about it - no strong speakers.

This corvette was a nightmare. Firstly, the top creaked in the heat and was in business four times and still unrepaired. Both front stabilizers had to be replaced and the entire sprocket and rack had to be replaced, the driver's floor had to be replaced and the battery had to be replaced. Problems simply persist and with a car that costs so much, I would have expected better quality.

The maintenance is free, but if they don't fix anything, it's worthless. The workshop is not familiar with the car and can't fix problems. I had to drive back four or five times before something was repaired. They even lied, actually repaired something and said on the repair sheet that nothing was wrong. I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy this car with an automatic, the rear view is confusing and very dangerous to secure it. The automation in the controls is stupid, mostly unnecessary and very annoying.

This is my first Jeep. I bought it because of the price and fuel consumption. We had a snowy winter, and it keeps well in the snow. I have a toddler, so the plastic backrest on the seats and the YES fabric work great. Controls are in strange places, and that took getting used to. Window noises from the rear windows are annoying. Seats are uncomfortable, and the armrest is terrible, cup holders very uncomfortable. For the second time in a month, the electric windows fail. All four windows get stuck, the controls work after repeated effort. The rear driver doesn't react, gets stuck. In zero-degree weather with a toddler a real problem. Today, he did it again - think about the trade...

Undetectable rattling & bumps in the interior and rough pavement. Balky starts at a standstill - drivers who are new to the car are always stuck in traffic jams. Seat belt alarms make you howl six times if you don't fasten your seat belt before starting the car, so you first have to open the door with the key, take off the key, fasten it, then pick up the key and start the car. Forget about it and you'll be punished by ugly noises. There's no sound insulation at all - hear any noise in wheel arches. The rear seat backrest mechanism to get into the rear doesn't go back into position, so the backrearches need to be adjusted every time. NO UMBLE SUPPORT. Subaverage directional stability. This car stinks.

I am a bit disappointed with my 07 SI sedan. I had several problems with it. Tons and tons of rattles in the interior that can never be repaired are buzzing in the speakers, and now my second gear is grinding like crazy. Problems in second and third gear are VERY common with these cars, and I now have difficulty pressing second gear at high revs where the SI lives. It's fun to drive, even though it doesn't deliver what it should be for its price. At almost 5k cheaper you get the cobalt-colored SS / ion redline with more power. For just 1-2 thousand more you get the mazdaspeed3 / GTI, which has a lot more spunk and sophistication. I would suggest trying the Mazdaspeed3 / gti before buying the Honda, unfortunately.

In 3 mo 13,000 miles and 400 gal = 32.5 mpg that's 95% hwy. I've got 27 mpg in one tank to 43 mpg in another tank. Most tanks average 30-32 hwy driving on the flat side from Raleigh nc to the nc coast. My best hwy mpg has been driving Raleigh nc west to winstone-salem nc. I've had it to dealers 4 times and they say computer said that everything works properly. I got the car for the high mpg. Gas prices are my enemy. I owed a 91 citizen and got 37 mpg. Wish I still had it.

It's a nice vehicle, but here's the bad stuff. Heat takes about 10 minutes to turn it on, every time you turn the air conditioner on, it defaults to air conditioning (the most annoying feature). If you have the Bo speaker system, your subwoofer is mounted on the spare tire, so be ready to take it off if you have collapsed on the roadside. Apart from the fact that I like everything else about the car, I know from a review that it doesn't have fog lights, but mine, it took me a while to find it. Headlights are also adjustable when they look weak. Upgraded sound system sounds fantastic, and it has XM radio! Dealers, sellers and bestsellers who have installed my XM all didn't know.

Had this car for 1 year and what a mistake. Should have stayed without Hyundai Accent, but they had no 4dr hatch. Had a problem with a constant speed sensor on the Auto-Trans. The car is slow, copes poorly in the snow and has less than good gasoline performance. Avg 28 combines City / Hywy. Should have better mileage with such a small engine.

I was expecting more from this car. I've been driving it for about 9 months now, the engine has to be broken in now, but the mileage is terrible. Hardly 400km on the tank and that's 50 / 50 city, hiway. I'm not driving that hard either. My friends with domestic v6's get something like that close. It's fun to drive, somehow I like a go-kart, but because of all the little things I'm thinking of swapping it for something else. Auto-Tranny also doesn't work for this underpowered engine, there are too many downshifts at the slightest trace of throttle. I wish I'd done more research instead of being dazzled by the fact that it was a new Honda. By the way, the orange color doesn't work too well for this car.

The result? Complete brake overhaul of calipers, discs and brake pads, which all needed replacing. Dealers said there was no reported problem, although I showed them pages and pages of customer complaints about the brakes. I did this out of my own pocket for the safety of my family. Now, before the warranty expires, the gearbox slips. We went to the dealer and said there was a recall and the problem was fixed? Wrong? Today, woman had to go back to the dealer, $95 dollars to look at it as it is no longer under warranty. Rental out of my pocket and the result is still TBD...... Terrible experience.

But this time I promise never to buy another piece of c * * p from Chrysler again! Outdated engine and transmission. Wooden car ride and handling, really bad mileage from the age-old design of the PUSHROD engine that has been around since 1989! And let's talk about quality, it's nowhere to be found! Wrong dashboard, bad assembly, inappropriate colors, really bad leather that looks fake in the way it wears and fades. We bought it new and the write-off hit us really hard. Sold for pennies in dollars! Avoid it at all costs, it doesn't even belong in a rental car fleet!

I have owned the last three versions of the Grand Prix and each has become more technologically advanced and stylish than the last, while construction quality and interior design have deteriorated. My 2007 Grand Prix pales in comparison to the interior design and materials in my 2000. mesh headliner and sun visor material scream "cheap." The plastic interior parts are visually and physically "hard." The carpet is coarse and the leather doesn't even smell of leather. Rear end, I am a Grand Prix lover and am embarrassed for GM. It seems as if the Grand Prix should have suffered the same agonizing death as its Pontiac brothers. Sorry GM, my next car will be Japanese.

I bought my Mini new in 2 / 08 and the fuel pump ran out at 17,000 miles. Although it was under warranty, I can only guess what problems lie ahead. I also had to replace one of the defective tires worth $249. The car is fun to drive and I have plenty of space as I no longer have to transport small children. However, as soon as I experience a major mechanical failure, I start looking for a new car. I plan to buy a new Honda or Toyota in 2 / 10.

This is our second BMW, we are so disappointed with the quality of the construction. The front bumper, a pitiful piece of plastic, just buckled and fell over while driving over a bump. Told by a BMW service representative that this happens so often on the x3 that people don't even bother to fix the bumper, but just drive around with it. It's an unconsciously bad construction, design and quality. There are other issues with the quality of the materials used in building this car. This is definitely our last BMW and if it wasn't a lease I would get rid of it right away.

My check engine lights up 3 times since March, two dealers can't find the problem, so they put the computer back and send me on the way. And my leather seat was defective, which was replaced. Did I mention that my Bluetooth was also replaced, and all before the 6,000-mile mark. What a lemon. If you own a Nissan, good luck if you have a warranty problem.

We swapped a 2004 Ford Explorer with this car, mainly because of the terrible road noise we had with the Ford. We have a decent new car with almost the same noise level. We didn't notice it during the two test drives as it was extremely windy on both days. The dealer now tells me that this car doesn't have the insulation that is taken into account in the Civic family. We were told that the top end of the Accord and Oddessy would have insulation and be much quieter. Great! Fuel economy isn't great even for a four-cylinder.

This Jeep has been leaked since Day 1. It has been repaired 6 times and has been out of service for more than 30 days. I filed a lawsuit under lemon law / and got an intermediary / without solution. 5 months later I was forced to buy a foreign used car so I could get to work. I do not recommend this Jeep to anyone! Chrysler does not support a product, they can certainly sell you a car, but the service is no longer there.

When I first drove the car, I fell in love with it and bought it straight away, and the very responsive engine coupled with 18-inch performance tyres made it fun. Just two months later and the clutch feels way too much like a gearbox, and the fuel consumption doesn't even come close to the stated technical specifications. Unless my dealer can solve the fuel consumption problem, I estimate that this car will cost me $400-500 more per year than I should expect based on the estimates quoted. As for the clutch, the feeling changed drastically when I received the first shipment. My dealer claims that it's running normally. I hope that's not a sign of the future.

Too much plastic. Window gearboxes gave up around 2100. Soft as a truck and hard as a sedan - choose one and stick with it if you're GM. Return it to the company headquarters 3,500 miles ago. Give me another bull as a present!

My biggest disappointment with this car is the mileage with gasoline. Granted, I am on average about 38 MPG, but nowhere near the stated 51 MPG. I could have bought a Chevy Aveo or Honda Fit for much less money. Quality is surprisingly poor - had to take the car to the dealer several times because of leaks in the flap area. The car is very uncomfortable for long trips - OK for excursions in the city. Seats are very hard and unsupportive. Performance is very fuzzy, especially on highways. If you press too hard, you have the feeling that things are about to break. Great second or third car, but not enough for all-round service.

I bought my 2008 Avenger in April 2008. I'm very disappointed about it. I've got 12478 miles on it. Grinding the brakes, doors and side panels swell like crazy... I can't fix this problem, Im in my 4th Mygig radio (continues to freeze). Sluggish Transe (4cyl). Front noises when turning or driving over a bump. AC doesn't work well, numerous blind spots, chrome plastic around the gear lever inside the shutter driver, poorly designed trunk pours water into the trunk when it's wet, and many more that just run out of space. PLEASE DO BUY ONE.JUNK This is just the worst car I've ever owned. 1997 I had a brand new avenger and loved it, so I thought I'd take a chance with the 2008. What a mistake.

I loved driving my used 2001 Limited Edition PT Crusier, but in 2007 I had some problems with it, so I decided it was time for a new one. Despite the previous problems I had, I thought I would have no trouble buying a brand new cruiser, so on January 1st, 2008 I bought a brand new cruiser. Do you think it was a pleasure? Not a bit! I had nothing but problems from day one! It was there for balancing three times, the tires were indexed several times, and now it squeals when I run over everything that makes the car bouce. It's so annoying! Body creaking shouldn't happen on a car less than a year old! I'm over my car and I'll never buy a Chrysler again!

I bought this car a year ago and was extremely dissatisfied with the performance in winter. If there is less or more than an inch of snow, the car does not move, it just spins. It was also parked on a lawn and had to be towed because it would just stir up mud and not move. I have a brand new radial on this car all year round and yet it cannot get out of its own way. The luggage rack provided by the factory is terrible. I am afraid to put my kayaks on it for fear that the luggage rack is too weak and will break under pressure. It is also not wide enough to accommodate the length of the kayaks.

I bought the car three months ago and have had it serviced five times in the last month and a half due to a squeaky problem that it causes when I turn it on for the first time in the morning. Very unhappy with the dealer and service technicians in van dyn hoven for not repairing the seemingly simple problem and offering a rental vehicle. Mileage is less than 20 km / h. Sunglasses are too small and do not fit into glasses. The fuel door broke when my husband pushed them with his arm when filling them in. Made of cheap plastic. Headrest and armrest are also uncomfortable for me.

I use my Ridgeland SUV a lot. I regularly smell burning grass after driving down dirt roads where grass grows. I had a severe fire in the engine compartment that caused over $5,000 damage. I had another small fire that I extinguished with a garden hose. There is a connection around the exhaust that catches grass and leaves that smolder and / or catch fire. You may remember the Honda advertisement during the last March madness in which a "herd" of Ridgelines crossed a field of tall grass. It was a brush fire in the making. This pickup truck is safe in the parking lot of the mall, but don't go near the grass. Honda hasn't responded.

After several very positive experiences with Toyota, I had a downer. Obviously, the more Toyota grows, the more it has taken some quality control out of its vehicles. I have 6k miles on me and have an off-and-on noise that happens at 75-80 (the dealer can't diagnose it because he can only drive it up to 70), linkage clatter, clatter of the passenger door and had to be towed because it wouldn't start (thank God I bought the extended service plan, otherwise I would have been really upset if I'd paid for towing a 3-month-old truck). I wouldn't mind a slightly better mileage, but it's not bad. Performance is good for a V6 and comfort is good too. I still like it, wish it were better.

The power steering is jittery, they have also mounted the ski stand incorrectly and the bike stand is too high on the car to even put a bicycle there. This car is nothing but trouble and bad design. Also, the extended warranty has about 3 sides of what it doesn't cover, and only 1 paragraph of what it covers, and maybe if you use the $1000 dollar warranty, it can now cover a radio if you're lucky. When I got my car back from the dealer, it seems like the SUV didn't even work.

It slows down too fast when the foot is taken off the accelerator. Sooner or later, I will fall behind. I am now in arbitration proceedings. I was told by a Toyota that the technology should drive aggressively, which is against the law. I now have to answer to an arbitration tribunal.

I bought a 2008 Dodge Caliber last October within a month of buying it. The gearbox is terrible. Whenever I could stop or start, it jolts and jolts as if it were about to stop. Apparently, some calibers have this problem, others don't. Besides, they said that there is no solution! Then I went back to have the front strut replaced and look again and again and change without a solution! Now the problem seems to happen when driving backwards. I'm really not happy with this vehicle.

I always buy AWD, but thought FWD would be fine and thought a slight increase in fuel consumption would be good. Wrong! This car doesn't get out of the way in the snow. It's so heavy at the back that the front tires don't have any weight. Forget about pulling on the road after a blizzard. MPG is 15.5 at best. You get close to 24 on the highway if you don't exceed 65 km / h. All in all, 15.5 is not 16-24 that they advertise. I'm a sad consumer if two of the three reasons I bought it were fraud.

This car has repetitive computers, ohm knobs, the air conditioner replaced, the cup holder jammed in the dashboard, the boot is leaking, the engine already has a "knock noise." It was literally in business almost as much as in my garage. Can't repair it in time because they don't seem to manufacture the parts until there's a problem. If it's a car you need to rely on, don't buy it. If you have the patience to work with the mechanics, do it, it's nice, but I'd recommend waiting until the next line comes out, my car seems to be a "beta" trial.

At the age of 54, this was my first ever new car... ever! Everyone said what great cars Hondas are, so I was excited to buy one of them, and on top of that my beloved item. At 1000 miles, it was in business twice because of fuel sensor problems. Now, at just one year and only 5700 miles, I'm really disappointed. It's fun to drive and I love its funny cool nerd look, but the quality is really missing.... little irritations: there's no defroster, radio speakers vibrate from the start, the side doors rattle. I'm a single old guy, so it was hardly treated crudely.

I loved this great looking car on the road! I loved it, loved it, loved it! Until I bought it! I was very disappointed from day one! I felt every tiny bump on the road, the steering wheel is very tight, so it's not particularly easy to manoeuvre. I also couldn't get the seat into a comfortable position and suffered from back pain until I got used to it. I'm 5.6 "and I think this car is not for the quick-witted. Mom, watch out! The metal anchors are so low that it took me about 20 minutes to assemble the car seat!

The lock on my driver's door keeps loosening and making a snarling noise as I ride over even the smallest bumps. The dealer has repaired it 5 times and the noise has come back. I am in the process of taking the car to an arbitration court in Lemon to force the dealer to give me my money back. Jim in MA

I preferred the C70 to an Audi because of the hardtop. I've had it in business seven times and 90 days since May '08 due to roof problems. Fortunately, none of these problems were major, but a big inconvenience for my time. My biggest problem was getting someone from the Volvo Group to call me to discuss any solution.

But it's a mechanical nightmare. This truck looks, drives and feels like it was assembled in a hurry. I only have 2500 miles on it and the trans jerks like a horse at least three times a day. Cadillac has reprogrammed some computer, but it keeps doing it and they say there's nothing they can do to fix it. It also runs very rough idle, in the first month when we had it, it was fine and now it vibrates so strongly at the traffic lights that it's embarrassing. Cadillac told me to use premium, and it still does. Sometimes the lift doesn't want to work. Should have got an 08 Sequoia.

We were so happy when we bought our Acadia. Great looks, performance and a solid feeling. After we bought the car, we learned how poor the fuel consumption was. I also noticed the hesitation uphill. Gas reaction is terrible when you step on it. At 8,000 miles the engine light turned on. Service center informed us that fuel cap and camshaft had problems? Camshaft? Only 8,100 miles with this car.

After a year of testing and testing various SUVs and crossovers, we decided on the HH and ordered exactly what we wanted. We had tested several HH and other hybrids and all were quiet, but none impressed us like the HH. When our HH came in, we were thrilled. It was beautiful and had everything we wanted except the noise! When we brake to brake, it sounds like a jet engine spinning down. It also has a click. We expected the calm we had experienced with the other HHHs, but were very disappointed. The dealer told us that some hybrids have this sound more than others - it's normal. I won't order again. I buy what I drive on the property.

My friend bought the van more than a year ago for himself and his children. It was sold with the "safety feature" that any obstacle would automatically open the side door. Since then, we have had constant problems with the electric doors - at any kind of inclination, the electric doors have a great chance of not closing and not slipping forward by themselves. Indeed, his 9-year-old son had his hand crushed in the doors (which do NOT open automatically) when he reached for his seat belt to fasten when the door closed. His two children are now afraid of the doors closing and warn their friends not to touch the doors. I am nearly 30 and even I get nervous about it.

I commute 120 miles a day, so gasoline performance was of paramount importance. I've always owned and liked Hondas - except for this one. The front passenger / driver sun visors are broken three times, the paint blows and flakes off the bumpers, the windshield is VERY long, prone to cracks and the sun visor takes up as little cargo space as there is, the rear child tie rods are so close to the seat that you can't use them. I was informed today that the brakes need to be replaced every 20-25,000 miles, as all have a new braking system in 2008 to eliminate braking noise that leads to 1 / 2 of normal braking life. I'd rather have the noise... and another car. $300 every 8 months is expensive.

For the past 9 years I've had an ML320 and been persuaded to swap it for a new Lexus. So I get the RX 350 and all I can say about it is that the fit and finish are great. In terms of rated power it seems to be too weak. I was used to a car that was much heavier, with lower horsepower than this dog. All I can say about the driveability is that it reminds me of an old men's car like the old Buick LaSabre. Very boring and no road feel. If you own an M-Class, hold on to it and appreciate it.

We bought this car because we thought we would never have a new car again, because we are retired and we are getting old and will not drive for so many years. The wind noise in this car is so bad that we cannot speak. We have returned it to the dealers several times. First, they said Nissan is working on the problems and to come back in a month, we have done that, after 3 trips to the dealership we get what is characteristic of this car and nothing can be done about it. We are very unhappy with the way we have been treated. I am really not just an old woman trying to get it under control, we have a problem and can't get anyone to help us. All I can say is do is not buy a Nissan Rouge, it is a waste of good money.

Let me start by saying I like the van and this is my second one. But the new design has a whistling sound when you do 65-70 MPH. The problem is around the windshield on the unit, between the window and the pillar that reaches up to the roof. The rubber insert is not long enough and it causes a whistling sound. You have to tape the outside until you can run a thin bead of lime under the rubber to prevent the wind from penetrating.

I bought a Kia Rio sedan in 2008 and it still has a new gearbox that still has problems with reversing automatic gearshift. I sit on the road waiting for the gearbox to shift. I feel this is a safety issue and Kia should fix it after a lot of shopping. They tell me that I don't know I have to drive and that there's nothing wrong with my car. It's the worst car I've ever had and I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy another one.

I take it out at least once a month to fix it, mainly with brakes and power steering, the brakes have been replaced twice and four times, the first set of brakes has been replaced at 9,000 miles, the power steering sensor has been repaired once and then replaced once because it would block me while driving. Feel very unsafe in this car, the dealership won't do anything for me. Trying to argue the MI Lemon Law with Pontiac Corp also had tire pressure issues. Let's just say I'll never get a GM again... I'm doing everything I can to get out of this lease!!

I bought this Silverado classic ext cab 2wd in October 06 for 25k. Trading value is now 6500. Two reasons, the first is the 4.3 vortec v-6. It is far too weak driven, the gearbox grinds and tries to shift too much between 35-40 mph. I had the gearbox replaced at 30K (unacceptable). I wanted to give GM another chance after driving Ford for so long. I won't do it again. Vehicle drives well and I get about 17.5 mpg through town.

The dealer stated that "it is not uncommon to burn through a Quart or 2 during a break. Funny. The light has been turned on at least eight times. In the last 10K it burned through 12 + qts. The dealer has done pressure tests, completed the test (although they never completed the process as they claimed), checked valve springs for kinks (according to TSB), no oil coming out of the exhaust and no leaks whatsoever. The dealer keeps telling me to drive more miles. No resolution so far. I'm done! Have seen others with the same problem on the Internet. Don't recommend this vehicle & MPG.

Sometimes the Trans behaves as if it does not know which gear it should be in, which has a negative effect on the MPG. Currently we are driving 14-15 City and 16-18 Highway. The dealer has installed a software update, but no help. Another update is available, but it would cost me 3-4 MPG and once installed, you cannot undo it! Had 9 other Buicks and loved them all. This car, once you have left its beauty behind, is a big disappointment. Would not recommend until GM permanently fixes the tranny problems. The dealer admits that this is a problem.

I just bought a 2008 Commander and I have water seeping through, even if I just wipe the handrails near the window with wipers. Go into speakers. Short, cracking noise, speakers on the right don't work. Who knows where the water is flowing now! Also, you can hear wind through the windshield while driving. Difficult to see through the rear windshield with the rear seats pulled up shouldn't use it. I can't really rate the vehicle as it's only been a month ago, not good so far.

I bought a 2007R / T in February. A manager drove it. She now has 6,700 units. She makes a babbling noise from the front. Sometimes, it seems to get louder. Two dealerships called Chrysler and they know the problem? But they don't know what it is and they don't know how to fix it? They say it's safe to drive? How do they know if they don't know what's wrong or fix it?

My predecessor, the ESV 2004, had what I thought was a luxury car. 2008 "s seats are tough, don't hold in position when cornering, the sun visor is bad, the previous model had more flexibility, the headrest's ability to bend forward is seriously lacking now. I was apparently one of the few people who accidentally used the windshield changing system EVERYONE. Since the addition of the rear view camera, this feature has been removed, that last damn thing stopped the purchase. I wish I'd bought a Mercedes GL 550 now, which will be my next purchase at this point, and most likely sooner rather than later. This is my tenth new Cadillac purchase in a row.

Poor handling at high speed. Car shakes at high speed. Car seems to float at 80 km / h. Very top heavy in corners. Car tight in corners, loose in the middle and loose in corners. Car performance seems to decrease during the day after driving. Low gear is too high, poor performance at start. Air conditioning fan very low. Door locks should be locked when the car is in gear.

Had a "03, loved it. In terms of specifications, the" 08 should be even better. It's fine in every way except while driving. If you're fine on a slick blacktop, any other surface you feel over the seat will become tarmac strips, cobblestones, bumps, and if you hit a hole... oh my God! I drive 55 miles of highway a day. I hate the ride every kilometer. Suspension way too stiff for Toyota's luxury flagship, just jar & ruolt. 17 "wheels don't help either. 16" means more absorbent rubber and a softer ride. You need to stop building cars to satisfy the specification wishes of some car magazine testers, whose standards are normally track handling, the biggest wheels & plenty of displacement. The Avalon is not a sports car!

Our third Audi. It's just not what we expected. Example - the gasoline door feels like a yugo and works like a yugo. Dashboard is right under cup holders and any dirt screws the audio together. $800 for repair and not under warranty. Service has declined dramatically over the years. It feels like they're trying to wrest every penny they can from us at every opportunity. Not much different from most others, but different from our previous experience. I've had it for 1.5 years and seems like there's always something wrong. Engine is great, great on snow. If I had to do it again, I'd get the GL 450 or 550. The Acura is more reliable, but doesn't drive as well and doesn't turn as sharply.

I have replaced this car with a Porsche 911 S and believe me, this car is not a Porsche. It is huge for a "sports car." A sports car is supposed to be small, powerful and agile. The driving behaviour of the Vette is comparable to an elephant that wants to perform at the Olympics on a suspended beam. Sure, I like the power under the hood. 30 horses with the dual-mode exhaust sound great, but that is about the only thing that is great about this car. Having driven BMW, Z-cars, Porsche and even my Mercedes E350, I am very disappointed with the way this car is handed over and arranged for the money. Can no one in the USA build a "sports car," at least not in the league of the above mentioned.

What a disappointment! The first year was fine with the vehicle, but now it is falling apart. In the cold it works badly, if it starts at all. Do not remember to drive in winter weather without snow tires. The alarm is a toast. The electronics is on the brakes. Seat belts do not retract. Weatherwear. Loud lump in the trunk when cornering. Has a violent tremor at closer highway speed. Difficult to find a comfortable driving position. Overall, the most disappointing vehicle we have ever owned! Will never buy a Honda again.

I've owned 10 cars in the last 25 years, and the CLS550 is undoubtedly the biggest disappointment. Bottom line - I have a luxury car worth over $80,000 with all the bells and whistles that drives like a 1972 Fiat. Despite being in business three times in the first 90 days, the vehicle continues to rattle and vibrate violently, the "premium sound system" sounds like a transistor radio, and the "air-conditioned seats" are nothing more than a dim fan with imperceptible effect. Two thumbs down!

The most annoying problem with the car is that there is a significant and very distracting vibration in the steering wheel, driver's seat and center console when the car is idle. That alone makes me uncomfortable with this car. The car has been serviced 3 times. American Honda Corp. "s position on this issue is that it is within manufacturing standards. There is also significant vibration in the steering wheel and roughness at highway speeds. The road noise is loud. This car does NOT get 34 mpg, at best 30. I would not buy this car again. I would recommend testing several cars and reading many customer reviews.

My wife hated the way he drove through town, so now it's mine. The gearbox is definitely a design flaw and there should be a recall. On the highway it feels like a dream. It's like being on a track and it requires discipline to stay below 100 km / h. I had a lift noise and after several service visits they had to replace the cylinder head. It was another nightmare. Dealer and BMW should have done better to compensate for my inconvenience.

If you pull forward every time (sounds like a gearbox) and we were told several times that this was normal. Now it's looked at. Brakes squealed and the whole neighborhood laughed at the new truck when it reversed. Now it squeaks when steering in both directions and the car has only 7,200 miles under its belt. Hate it already. You don't know what's going to happen next.

I have my rabbit for 2 years and love to drive it. The problem with this car is that if something happens to it (or even if you need an oil change), you get stuck in the poor house. Be careful, the rabbit is very maintenance intensive and once out of the plot expensive. I was slightly behind, little dent: 900 dollars. I drove a dirt road leading to a mountain trail and bumped into a bump, the gearbox needs to be replaced: 7000 dollars. Even an oil change: 90 dollars. I save the 7000 dollars needed to fit a new gearbox, and choose a reliable, low-maintenance Japanese car as I had it before.

The styling of the car is impressive as it has the lines of a much more expensive car, the ride was disappointing, very bumpy and not driver-friendly at highway speeds. I was willing to overlook the firm ride when the stability on the highway was solid, but that's just not the case. The gearbox tends to shift up at low revs (1K-2K), which leaves a tired feeling under normal acceleration, although the 6 cyl is very responsive when you step on it or use the paddle shift instead.

After waiting for this car and paying for the upgrades, I feel like my money has gone down the drain. Day 1, picking up the car, leaving the dealership, and there's a cracking sound from the suspension, the CD player was broken. As I took the car in, I realized that the suspension had to be repaired, the front tires had to be replaced, and the CD player among other things. A month after taking possession, the car starts making all kinds of rattles and loud noises when it comes to a stop. The cat has been replaced, and lots of clips and mould in the car. The gearbox started popping out of third gear, which is still being worked on. Overall, Honda has already done over 9K warranty work on the car!

My main criticism of this car is that it doesn't have a lockable glove compartment. For heaven's sake, Kia's got lockable glove compartments. How can you hand your vehicle over to a valet? Probably a Mercedes would drive to valet parking more often than most? On top of that, access to the rear seats is done by lifting and pulling the rear seat. Cars that are sold at half the price have electric motors that do that. It's like driving an old Euro taxi. Quality of construction, first year, 3. Brake disc cover fell out when the boot was closed, wailing belt disc, seat belt not foldable properly.

I got a lemon. My Escape was great for the first 6 months and now it seems to be in the store every week. Rear hatch mechanism failed twice, had to replace capacitor motor due to a gearbox leak. My temperature and door lock options on the convenience package change on their own and Ford has no solution yet. Fog lights fill up with water and go out.

When I bought this car, I loved the equipment. Today, almost two years later, I regret the purchase. Although I am still very pretty, everything breaks in a minivan: the rear cup holders, the rear sonar, the rear cover. Every little piece of plastic that can break breaks. I could understand when I was hard on the vehicle.

I bought the Tiburon new. I immediately had problems with the tires. I had to ventilate them within the first month, and then every 6-8 weeks. It was returned to the dealer four times. They said no obvious leak, maybe a gasket problem. So they added nitrogen. 8 weeks later the tire was low again. Deal will not replace the tire. Hyundai customer service says Hyundai is not responsible for defective tires, the tire manufacturer is. I bought road hazards and extended warranty. No one covers defective tires. I do not feel safe driving.

2 radiators, turbo steering, P / S pulley, A / C repair, still Smimmys when starting from the stop. Trans shifts hard from time to time, as if I had landed at the back. Dealer says no problem found. Comes three to five times a day in rain, sucks fuel in the rain. Dealer says this is normal. Before the computer is updated, maybe three times a week. The truck has electricity, I'm afraid to go out of circulation. Will the radiator leak? Will I start a desert fire from the rain? Do I have to run 60 miles because the truck breaks down? My 2000 Ford f250 4X4 7.3L, (newly purchased), 268,000 miles in the store 4 times.

The rest is mostly negative, the driving position is very uncomfortable for me. I'm an average size 5 '6 "woman and I think the seats are too small. If it was a purchase from another car dealership, I would have returned it the first week, but I've been stuck with it for years. He's been in the store 5 times. The clutch makes a noise when it's pressed and again when it's released, the side windows rattle in its gaskets, after 2,500 miles the service engine started up and the cruise control stopped working. I definitely should have tested this car longer and explored other options!

I like the petrol performance, the ride and the handling, but at 1100 miles I noticed that when I filled the tank, the gas supply was only three quarters full! Now at 2100 miles I have a indicator light on the engine and the code says that the level sensor in the tank no longer works! It is a disappointment to have problems with such low mileage, and I wonder if this is the beginning of things to come!

An annoying rattle turned into a much bigger problem: I pressed the clutch, then the gear lever jumped out of the gear into idle, without even touching it. Then, while driving and in gear, the gear lever just jumped out and into idle. No clutch needed. Now, on the second gearbox. Very noisy around the gearbox; difficult to shift - especially into third gear. Last night it started: pressed clutch and once on the accelerator pedal and let go: Next thing I know, the engine revs totally, as if I'm still accelerating! BLACK! I just want a replacement - here we go!

Have a 1998 GS 400. I have owned / rented at least 5 other cars since 1993. It does not live up to the hype. Extremely annoying feeling, gas-electric-gas-getting in / out etc. at speeds around 59 km / h. Tiny trunk. I am trying to get out under this "Edsel." PS: The mileage is really only a few hundred meters better than my GS 400.

I only had to replace $270 out of pocket brake pads. I have owned many new cars in my life and never replaced brake pads under 10k miles. That was a disappointing experience, so I wrote a letter to American Honda. There are other similar complaints on the Internet. Honda needs to make improvements to the materials of the brake pads. Otherwise, the car is comfortable, fun to drive and economical.

Apart from numerous dealer visits within the 25 km that I have covered with this car, this is not a bad car: the engine is very quiet, quiet, but not as powerful as I would wish, even with manual gearbox. The minus points for this car are various chassis noises & terrible manual / factory flywheel combination. At about 5000 miles, the manual gearbox had to be replaced. Immediately after, various TSBs for interior noise & passenger side A-pillar head airbag cover were replaced. Now, I hear a clatter in the suspension area when I ride over any kind of bumps or road inadequacies. In addition, plastic clips that cause noise come loose in the interior.

I did a lot of research to see what new car I wanted to buy. I chose the Impala. Had a 72 and loved it. After taking my time and looking around, I finally bought the 08 Impala. But I was afraid to touch the brakes. I had replaced them and the day after they were just as bad, if not worse, than before I had them edited. Pulsed as I stopped and jolted me back and forth until I stopped. The front axle gasket had to be repaired, it was leaking. I had an emissions sensor go out and had it repaired. OnStar is not working properly, the dealer checks the recalls to see what needs to be repaired. Seats are very uncomfortable. Very disappointed. I researched and got stuck. Oh, the glove box broke.

The rattles and leaky windshields make you feel like you're watching an outdoor concert with bad music. If you hit a pothole, OnStar wants to know if everyone in the car is OK - even though they think I'm about 80 miles from where I actually was... and they called three times to check if there was anything wrong. I listened to them more than the radio. Where can I find the fuse to kill the animal?

I researched this vehicle before buying it and found that all but one were good reviews, one stating that he had electrical problems right from the start. Well, I'm the second. After only 10 months, the alarm went off when I unlocked and opened the door. They replaced a shift chart. Then, the steering wheel didn't tilt anymore. They changed the switch twice and then the steering column. Then, it didn't tilt anymore and didn't tilt anymore, so they replaced a shift chart. Three weeks later, it does it again. DVD volume is much louder than the radio and they can't fix it. The fan under the hood is sometimes very loud. I get a lot of rattling and wind noise now.

Our problems began after 4 months and less than 3000 miles when a p.S. hose burst on January 21st, 2008. The dealer said that probably water in the p.S. hose was frozen and the line burst! In N.A. there were no hoses available, so the dealer finally pulled out a new vehicle to get us going after a week. A second p.S. hose burst on February 13th, causing smoke and exhaust fumes to enter our vehicle while driving! The P.S. hose was replaced again.

I have owned this car for 1 / 1 and had nothing but problems with the front suspension. This car has very weak front springs, especially the right side down with every bump in the road, inclined driveways forget it. The front underside has had to take a beating with such a weak suspension. Was (so far) several times in the store. The dealer has replaced the front strut, aligned and repositioned a strut, also to get rid of a loud bang on the left front. Comes back to the store next week. Springs are so weak that I can compress them with one hand Fuel consumption I find above average, great dashboard and indicators, comfortable seats (do not spill them).

The first car I've ever bought. Family has always owned a Dodge without problems. I've owned the vehicle for 7 months and have been in business 7 times (mainly due to unreliable technicians). I have a squeak in the dashboard and in the passenger door that just won't go away. Recently, the bed of the pickup was moved out of the passenger compartment. Even after 2 hours driving time, the MDS doesn't know what to do (the vehicle keeps swelling with fluctuating revs).

Start with my X5 has only 3500 miles in it, at 2000 miles came the engine light, by mechanics something is wrong with the catalytic converter, recently a fan while driving on the highway crashed onto my front panel and caused a quarter-sized hole, the side trim behind the headlight is made of composite or some kind of plastic.

Ahhhh - now I can say what I can. It gets bad gasoline mileage and I have only 6706 miles on it and had it already in the service department 3 times with window switch and engine light going on. There is no electricity.

This is the worst car I have ever owned. Passenger windows rattle, brakes are bad, the seat is hard and uncomfortable, the radio sound is dreary, the paint feels rough, as if it has dirt embedded, the steering wheel does not return to the central position without help. I read all the reviews before buying and can't believe they were overwhelmingly positive. Maybe the higher models are more comfortable.

I have 8 Passats from 2007 that I use as TaxiCabs. 3 engines and 4 transmissions are already gone. Granted, we put a lot of miles on it, but the turbo engine just can't stand it. Computers require multiple visits to the dealer for the reflash and these cars absolutely burden the company's wallet. I've always owned Audis and VW's and never had so many problems. Absolute windfall.
I was disappointed with the ride. It certainly wasn't comparable to my former Mercury Mountaineer, but the handling is very agile. I wish I'd noticed how bland the car was compared to other SUVs.

The 650 has what BMW calls an "inherent characteristic": when you drive in "manual" gear-shifting mode, the vehicle tends to stutter when you stop. Imagine bobbing your head back and forth like a dashboard doll. The vehicle is also prone to severe failures when driving at m1 (such as in a multi-storey car park looking for a place or moving forward on a measured motorway ramp) and to a lesser extent when it comes to the automatic. The failures are dangerous and you have to drive defensively at 4 miles per hour. BMW says the problem is related to the software - it thinks the engine is stalling and the computer is throttling the engine. BMW will not fix the problem.

I now think I made a mistake in buying this vehicle. I thought it would be a great investment. No, the petrol performance is bad and there's this extremely annoying wind noise on the driver's side. From other comments it seems that it can't be repaired. Yes, the vehicle doesn't look good, but we bought it because of the equipment and the price. We're very disappointed and are looking at our options to get something else. It doesn't work very well on the road. It has a tendency to float and I can almost see the gas meter moving. As another guy said, I guess you get what you pay for.

I've had this car for three months, 2100 miles so far. My concerns are this: the engine spins when I hit the brakes (but not always), the brakes seem weak and just don't feel right, the paint job seems to be cheap. I notice orange peel surface and there are spots, especially near the windshield where the clear paint is worn out or never existed. I don't seem to get the gasoline performance I should be. I drive about 85% downtown and usually get about 30 km / h. I don't think I'll keep this car for long and I'm worried about how it will look and run after 2 years.

I bought this terrible minivan and have been dissatisfied ever since.,.Front-end vibrates whole car.. dealer had car for 1 / 2 of the month and factory representative said, "he knows the vibrations I experience..." And... I now submit to BBB as a Hyundai warranty application, but for the extra $$$$$I would have spent, it would have been worth saving myself this aggregate... I took another entourage from the lot & test drive.. The vibration existed in the new toooo.. Especially at 75-80 the steering wheel wobbled uncontrollably... Must be a technical defect or my car was built on a day before or after a vacation.

If you are interested in an 08 Acadia, do yourself a favor and run! All the problems with the first year of 07's just continued with the 08's. I went back to the dealer every month in the first year of ownership with one problem after another. The biggest problems are the fuel consumption of 10mpg and several water leaks that could not be fixed. Please note that if you decide to buy and have problems, the only thing you get from GM customer service is a free oil change. Please learn from my mistake!

Due to the poor design of the Freedom Hardtop and the inability of the passenger seat to fold forward far enough to allow even small dogs easy access, it is, in my opinion, almost impossible to get any passengers out of the vehicle in the event of a crash.

My Jeep Patriot came to me from the factory with a broken crank and a faulty sensor, so I can hold my breath every morning while listening for 10-15 seconds before finally turning around. I think to myself, this is the day it doesn't start, every morning! I'm going to see a certified Chrysler dealer for the third time to fix this problem! wish me luck! On top of that, there's something wrong with the fuel gauge and I ran out of gasoline on the highway because I was standing about 5 miles after the tank light went on. One headache after another with this Jeep Patriot and I had such high hopes. Buyers beware!

No legroom for the rear seats. No automatic on / off headlights. Hard driving. Opening the driver's door after a ride does not open the back door. You must use either the remote control or the door knob to open the back doors. Poor fuel economy. Wish there were at least one beep when you arrive at walls or curbs (this is expected for cars over 30,000). Tom

The Tacoma was more spacious. It has some spongy brakes to get used to (TRD 4x4). The interior is A +! Good performance and ride. Very comfortable sitting. I've owned Chevys all my life. This is the first Toyota I've bought. Sold was my 04 Colorado Z71 crew cab, which blows it away by hand. Although I bought the fully loaded Colorado, it just feels cheap to drive compared to the Tacoma. Great job Toyota! Some extra lighting for the 4x4 and various other switches would help. I also had to order an interior filter. Toyota makes the slot for one, but doesn't place one there? C'mon.

If you have not had any problems, just wait. I not only had numerous problems, but the dealer is just as bad. Steering noise AC went from brakes squealing now steering rod WHAT NEXT!!! 07 Car of the Year???????

I bought a 2008 Rondo today, I think I made a mistake, the test drive took place in city traffic, where I did not see some of the defects, on the long drive home there was a very annoying noise in the driver's window (incoming air), the car is very "floating" and seems too smug on the road, I do not feel to be in command of my car, the four cylinder engine howls so loudly as if it could explode before we really get going, I think about bringing it back in the morning and getting my money back, a cheap car in which I do not feel safe.

After 6 weeks in possession of the car and 3,000 miles, I noticed color chips on the side in front of the rear tires. I took it to the dealer and they took photos and sent them to Mitsubishi and they said they wouldn't cover it up, that it was my fault. The front tires release stones that cause sandblasting on the side of the car, they said they didn't make mud flaps for them yet. It's getting worse every day. I see more people have the same problem. I'm now filling out paperwork for the attorney general.

I've had my Explorer for about a year now and I still hate it. First, I'm a mountain biker. As I tried to tow a trailer full of weight, our CrossCountry mountain bikes got stuck on the Explored. Plus, there must be some pretty sizeable mud flaps on this car. Very disappointing V8. Nobody knows where the inner door handles are and the exterior look is about as plain as possible. This car is incredibly clumsy and shuffles in real 4-wheel situations that I don't trust.

It wasn't worth it - I'd rather spend more money on gasoline to have a car with a bit of torque. Resale value looks great - will move toward something sportier in the range of 200 + horsepower / torque. Not a bad car, but it's the first / last Honda I'll ever own.

I am an avid Ford owner, but I am extremely disappointed to learn that at 54,000 miles I am told that they know there is a problem with the transmission (CVT) and that they recognise the risk it poses to the public, but they are not prepared to repair at their expense. I really do not want another car, but I cannot justify repairing that car.

We exchanged a 1998 Toyota Corolla to buy our 2007 Nissan Versa in order to save gasoline, and the sticker on the window indicated that we would get 28 city miles and 35 highway miles. We've owned this car for almost a year now and come just 23 miles to the gallon, far from our old Tokota, which was running perfectly. So now, we not only have a car allowance, but a car that gets terrible gasoline miles. We've tried to unload this car several times to buy a car that gets good gasoline miles, only to find that a car that we paid less than a year ago for $14,000 is only worth about $9 or 10,000. I'm so sad that we don't own our Tokota anymore. Nice car, fun to drive, but don't buy it to save money.

6-speed gearbox is annoying. Constantly in town and in the countryside. Dashboard and door panels in the interior are cheap. Same material I have in my GM work car! Interior is hard to clean. Outside is time-consuming to dry after washing. Lots of nooks and crannies. Nice to look at, a pain to own.

I didn't expect to get 19 MPG on hwy after reading on the Jeep website that you get 380 miles of range per full tank. 210 miles into the trip on flat South Florida hwy, I had to stop for gasoline and every 210 to 230 miles thereafter for the rest of the trip and on the way back. Yes, air conditioning was on, but 19 mpg. I love the car, the interior and exterior design, but I'm very disappointed with the gasoline performance. Mileage was an important factor in the purchase decision and I feel I was lied to.

EPA 23 to 27? Was that measured while it was going straight downhill? Combined highway and road driving is 19 mpg and that was with the cruise control on the highway. If you turn back after refueling and then drive 10 miles in the city, 15 mpg is displayed, about as much as my 4200 pound VW Vanagon and not even close to a 2001 C280 Mercedes 6 or a BMW 325 6 cyl, both German cars get from 25 to 34 mpg on the highway. That reminds me it was 27 mpg on the highway, but that ended when the first hill approached, then the engine was switched on and spun to 5,000 rpm and the MPG gauge crashed to the low teens. Sorry Honda, but that's not a gasoline eagle, it eats!

Shortly after I got this car, something started rattling in the door panel. I had to go to 3 different dealerships to finally get one that was ready to take off the door panel to fix it. Squeak / rattle all over the car when it is driving on rough ground. Roof, when it is stored in the trunk, squeaks like crazy. Windows squeal when it is rolled all the way up where it hits the roof.
